02-09.title: Standards for Psychological Testing Published
02-09.description: On February 9, 1966, the American Psychological Association first published the "Standards for Educational and Psychological Tests and Manuals", setting guidelines for the development and use of psychological and educational tests.

02-10.title: Publication of "The Conduct of Inquiry"
02-10.description: On February 10, 1964, Abraham Kaplan's influential book "The Conduct of Inquiry: Methodology for Behavioral Science" was published, shaping discussions about research methods in psychology and the social sciences.

02-11.title: First Issue of Educational and Psychological Measurement
02-11.description: On February 11, 1941, the first issue of the journal "Educational and Psychological Measurement" was published, providing a dedicated venue for research on tests, measurement, and assessment in psychology and education.

02-12.title: Birth of Charles Darwin
02-12.description: On February 12, 1809, Charles Darwin was born. His theory of evolution by natural selection strongly influenced comparative and developmental psychology by encouraging scientific study of human and animal behavior.

02-14.title: Psychology of Romantic Love
02-14.description: Valentine's Day highlights the psychology of love; research on attachment theory links adult romantic relationships to early caregiving bonds, and studies continue to explore the neurochemistry and culture of expressing affection.
